ruleset.name: cleancode
ruleset.description: Contains specific clean code rules for the Symfony2 framework.

rule.name: ClassNameSingleResponsibility
rule.message: Try to avoid general suffixes like {0} found {1}. It might violate of the single responsibility principle.
rule.description: Yeah you are on the right track. There is no business logic in the entities and the controllers are slim. Oh dear. Now you have classes like UserManager or PageHandler. But what do this classes? You might violate of the single responsibility principle. Split the Manager class. What do the methods? Can you use the event dispatcher pattern? No? Maybe better general suffixes are Builder, Writer, Reader, Converter.
